alert.note: Alert for Franklin (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Tornado Warning issued December 14 at 8:19PM EST until December 14 at 8:45PM EST by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: The National Weather Service in Tallahassee has issued a * Tornado Warning for... North central Franklin County in Big Bend of Florida... * Until 845 PM EST. * At 818 PM EST, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located over Apalachicola, moving northeast at 25 mph. Law enforcement reported strong winds and minor damage in Apalachicola. HAZARD...Tornado. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. * This tornadic thunderstorm will remain over mainly rural areas of north central Franklin County, including the following locations... Yent Place, Franklin, Creels, Hays Place and High Bluff. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN
info.instruction: This Tornado Warning replaces the Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued for the same area. TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris.
